reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Game changer! My scalp doesn't itch anymore!
reviews.reviewText: I am not one who washes my hair every day. It is more like once, maybe twice, a week. Every winter, I get a dry, itchy scalp, and I am constantly scratching my head to the point of dandruff or some kind of dermatitis that causes flakes in my hair. And every winter I try to find products to alleviate this issue. This year, I did a coconut oil treatment and while I waited, I went on Amazon and found this and the conditioner. After reading the reviews and doing some quick research, I decided to try it. It arrived the next evening. That was a couple of weeks ago. I have washed and conditioned my hair about three times with this product and it has made such a difference. I do not itch anymore. I am seeing less and less dandruff. The smell is a little different than I am used to, but it isn't unpleasant. Had I known about this, I would have tried it a long time ago. If you battle the same problems I do, just buy it. It's not too expensive and the relief I feel is sooo worth it!((I wrote the same review for the conditioner.))

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smell not THAT bad, don’t forget to transition b/t shampoos. Conditioner useless.
reviews.reviewText: Where to start.... So I have always had Seb Derm but as soon as I moved to Florida in 2017 it was the absolute worst it had ever been! I had insane red itchy hot spots and disgusting huge flakes of skin just stuck to my scalp that were so noticeable, I have super thick hair but it was constantly falling out! I had to shower at least once a day just to keep it some what under control pain wise. Then a miracle happened! My friend introduced me to Monat Shampoo in mid-2017 and it really seemed to be helping, the redness and pain had subsided but the giant flakes were still an issue. About a year ago when they changed their packaging I think they changed their formula because I started having the same issues or maybe my hair just got used to it and it was no longer effective! So I was on a mission to find something that actually worked! I spent weeks researching shampoos (mind you I’ve even tried prescription ones to no avail) and then I kept seeing this one on lists over and over again, The Body Shop Ginger Shampoo. People raved about how it helped their seb derm, the only real down side I kept reading about was the smell but I’m like heck, if it’ll help me poor head I’ll try anything! So I bit the bullet and purchased The Body Shop Ginger Shampoo and The Body Shop Ginger Conditioner. It arrives, honestly, I don’t know what everyone is complaining about it really is not that bad... it just kind of smells like ones of those ginger candies, slightly medicinal but not overwhelming. For the first couple of weeks I alternated using the Monat shampoo and the Ginger shampoo and conditioner (every other ginger shampoo) and then just the ginger shampoo, completely phasing out the Monat. And OMG let me tell you! My flakes are gone not even a little one, no redness and now I can go more than 2-3 days between washing my hair!! I even use it on my eyebrows when they start to flake up as well! I have been using this shampoo since the end of May and I’m so happy it’s worked for my Seb Derm! But now... the not so great... again, I have really thick hair so I feel like I use quite a bit of the product but there is still a little left in the 13.5oz after 2+ months so that’s not too bad. It’s not moisturizing at all, my hair isn’t brittle but it isn’t particularly soft either, and the conditioner is completely useless. I’m still using the Monat leave in conditioner until I find something better just to be able to get the knots out of my hair. And because it’s not moisturizing it’s doesn’t add the weight which brings your hair down so in turn it actually makes it thicker and more fluffy especially in this Florida humidity! But with all that being said! I still would rather not have a horrible itchy, painful scalp with disgustingly huge pieces of skin falling off my scalp! I’m so glad I found this product! Anyone recommend a conditioner that won’t wreck my progress?

reviews.reviewText: Having suffered with dandruff for most of the last 20 years, I wasn’t expecting much. But after 3 washes with this shampoo it almost completely disappeared. It’s remarkable.Rather than strip everything off your hair and scalp, like other anti-dandruff treatments do, it seems to be very gentle. It never leaves my hair or scalp feeling dry. I wash once a day and use the conditioner once or twice a week.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: The best shampoo I've used so far!
reviews.reviewText: I suffer from a skin condition (a type of eczema) that affects my scalp and I've had to use all kinds of shampoos the past 10 years, including high brand ones that are meant to be the best to help me or some prescribed by doctors but none of them worked, or if they did, it was only for a few months until my problem came back again.Around 1 year ago I decided to try this shampoo as I was running out of new options and I've been using it consistently every 2 days since then, and I can happily say I've never had any problems again! I honestly 100% recommend it, it's worth a try even just to deal with an itchy scalp or etc.I never write reviews but read them all the time before buying products so I felt like sharing how pleased I am with this one!
